英文法規名稱: Organizational Act of the Executive Yuan
沿革內容:
1.Enacted and promulgated a total sixteen articles of the Act on March 31, 1947
2.Amended and promulgated a total sixteen articles of the Act on April 22, 1947
3.Amended and promulgated a total seveneen articles of the Act on December 25, 1947
4.Amended and promulgated Article 3, Article 5, and Article 15 of the Act on May 13, 1948
5.Amended and promulgated Article 3 and Article 15 of the Act by the Presidential Order on March 21, 1949
6.Amended and promulgated Article 5 of the Act by the Presidential Order on November 20, 1952
7.Amended and promulgated Article 3 of the Act by the Presidential Order No.3666 on November 20, 1980
8.Amended and promulgated a total fifteen articles of the Act by the Presidential Order No.09900024171 on February 3, 2010, and enacted on January 1, 2012
9.Amendments to Articles 3, 4 and 15 
  Amendment Date: January 19, 2022
10.Amendments to Articles 3
   Amendment Date: April 26, 2023

法規內容.條文內容: The Act is established in accordance with Article 61 of the Constitutional Law.
The Executive Yuan shall exercise the powers granted by the Constitutional Law.

The Executive Yuan shall have seven to nine Ministers without Portfolio, specially appointed.
The Ministers without Portfolio may hold concurrent positions as the ministers of the Commissions or the Councils mentioned in the preceding article.
The Executive Yuan establishes the Directorate-General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics and the Directorate-General of Personnel Administration.
The Executive Yuan establishes the Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan).
The Executive Yuan establishes the National Palace Museum.

The Executive Yuan establishes the independent administrative institutions equivalent to the second-level agencies of the Central Government:
(1)Central Election Commission;
(2)Fair Trade Commission; and
(3)National Communications Commission.

The Executive Yuan Premier shall generally manage and govern all the affairs, and direct and supervise the affiliate agencies and the personnel thereof. 
In the event that Premier fails to perform his duties for any reason, the duties shall devolve on Vice Premier.
The Executive Yuan Premier may invite or appoint any relevant person to attend the Executive Yuan meetings.

The Executive Yuan shall have one Secretary-General, specially appointed, to manage the general staff affairs, and two Deputy Secretaries-General, one of whom shall be a political appointee of equivalent ranking to Senior fourteenth grade and shall assist Secretary-General with the staff affairs of the Executive Yuan. 
The Executive Yuan shall have one spokesperson, specially appointed, who may be held concurrently by a political appointee in charge of press release and communication.
The official ranks, grades, and headcounts of personnel at the Executive Yuan shall be regulated by a separate Personnel Establishment Table.
For the purpose of managing a specific affair, the Executive Yuan may establish an internal dedicated department.

The Act shall take into effect on January 1, 2012.
The effective date of the amended Articles of the Law shall be set by the Executive Yuan.
